data.title: Will Smith Acted, Fired Prop Gun and Operated Camera at Same Time on Set of 'Bad Boys: Ride or Die'?
data.meta_description: The actor, known for his infamous Oscars slap in 2022, was intent on making a comeback in 2024.
data.text:
Claim:

An authentic video shared in June 2024 shows actor Will Smith simultaneously operating a movie camera strapped to his body, acting and pretending to shoot a gun on the set of "Bad Boys: Ride or Die."

Rating:

True

About this rating

In June 2024, ahead of the release of his film "Bad Boys: Ride or Die," a viral video of Will Smith appeared to show him acting and and pretending to shoot a gun with a camera strapped to his body .

Many online shared the video, praising the actor's skills. One user on X, referencing the infamous slap Smith gave to comedian Chris Rock at the 2022 Oscars, wrote, "Imagine letting a little slap stop this greatness. Will Smith is HIM." Sports and pop culture blog Bar Stool Sports also shared the video on TikTok with the caption, "Will Smith filming in this scene is UNREAL." The video was shared by The Daily Mail tabloid on TikTok as well.

The video shows Smith moving through a set wielding a gun, with a camera strapped to his chest. He turns the camera as he moves through the scene so it captures his perspective over his gun.

The above video is authentic, was indeed shot on the "Bad Boys: Ride or Die" set, and originated on Smith's verified TikTok profile. As such we rate this claim as "True."

Smith shared the video himself on June 4, 2024, with the caption, "Just wait until you guys see this scene in @Bad Boys: Ride or Die â€¦"
